SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 31st July, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT
(a) French Front. There is no material change in the situation. Between RHEIMS and the ARGONNE the enemy carried out an attack in the neighbourhood of PERTHES, and drove in the French out-posts on a front of about 500 metres. S.W. of RHEIMS several hostile attacks have been repulsed between ST. EUPHRAISE and MONT DE BLIGNY. In this neighbourhood the line runs 500 metres North East of ST. EUPHRAISE to the cross-roads 1 kilometre North of BLIGNY and the Northern slopes of MONT DE BLIGNY. Heavy fighting continues in the neighbourhood of FERE en TARDENOIS. FERE EN TARDENOIS Station has been re-captured by the enemy, and the village of SERINGES was lost and retaken by the French. South East of SERINGES the line runs through MEUROY FARM - SERGY - HILL 212 (S.E. of SERGY) - North and East of RONCHERES.
(b) British Front. During the night we carried out successful raids in various sectors of our front, capturing few prisoners. Hostile artillery has been active on both sides of the SOMME and has shewn considerable activity about MERRIS and in the KEMMEL sector.
2. ITALIAN FRONT. There is nothing to report.
MACEDONIAN FRONT. In ALBANIA the Italian right wing and centre has been forced back for an average distance of seven miles on a front of sixteen miles to the line CHAFA DARZ - LIAPARDA (3 miles North of Berat) - BISTROVICA.
General Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
Issued at 12.50 p.m.
31st July, 1918.
